frontmatter.title: We're pressured to not write tests. Here's how to overcome that, and why you should.
frontmatter.description: It's true: having tests gives you safety. Safety to add new features. Safety to refactor code. Safety to fix one bug without causing two more. And they're completely automated, saving time that you would've spent manually testing. These benefits are a real game-changer in the software development industry, allowing us developers to confidently build products - with fewer bugs - in less time. And yet, not all of us write tests. Why?
